response: narrative=Alison Atkins was last seen boarding a bus near Black Isle Road. Concern arose when a friend reported Alison's reluctance to attend school recently. Her vehicle, unexpectedly parked in a distant area, was discovered abandoned, fueling concerns she might have traveled to another city. With the involvement of her colleague, Jack White, efforts intensified. Eventually, she was traced by police to a safe location in another city.

narrative=Alison Atkins was last seen boarding a bus near Ord Drive, Muir of Ord. Her friend, Jenna Butler, alerted authorities when Alison's vehicle was found abandoned near a remote mine in the wilderness.

narrative=Alison Atkins was last seen boarding a bus near Smith Drive, IV30 4NE, after leaving a sports club with a friend. She was later found safely at 25 Southside Road, Inverness, traced by police.

narrative=Alison Atkins was last seen leaving her home on Black Isle Road, Muir of Ord. Her foster mother, noticing she hadn’t returned by evening, alerted authorities. It's believed Alison might have travelled without telling her family, possibly to visit a friend or a familiar place. Tips suggested she was spotted at Hamilton Drive, IV30 4NN, and near 9 Caroline Street, IV40 8EH, locations she had mentioned during conversations with friends, including Shannon Patel and Hilary Carey. The police focused their search around these areas and were able to trace her back to her residence the following morning, safe and unharmed.

narrative=Alison Atkins' vehicle was found abandoned near a wilderness area. Colleagues reported she took a bus from 7 Lotland Street to a library near a mine. Utilities at her home were disconnected before she left.

narrative=Alison Atkins was last seen boarding a bus near 25 Southside Road, Inverness, headed towards a friend's location. Her foster mother, concerned after Alison didn't return home as expected, reached out to Alison's colleague, Irene Stephens, at the library they occasionally visited. Despite initial low risk concerns, Alison was found safe at home on Black Isle Road, Muir of Ord, having inadvertently taken the wrong bus and staying overnight with a friend.
narrative=Alison Atkins was last seen by a friend near a wilderness close to a mine after taking a bus from 39 Greig Street, Inverness, IV3 5PX.
